content.raw:
When we release sdf 1.6 the else clause will still be valid? If doesn't, I would prefer something like:

```
if (std::string("1.4").compare(SDF_VERSION) == 0) 
  xxx
else if (std::string("1.5").compare(SDF_VERSION) == 0) 
  yyy
else
  FAIL <<< "Please add support for sdf version: " <<< SDF_VERSION
```

I have a  personal fight with the massive use of "else" clause, specially when the "else" should hide just one option.
